text: Irving Thomas Stuttaford, OBE (4 May 1931 – 8 June 2018) was a British physician, author, and medical columnist of The Times. He served as a Conservative Member of Parliament from 1970 to 1974. In 2002, he retired as Senior Medical Advisor for Barclays Bank. In the years that followed he continued to write a regular monthly column for The Oldie and was a frequent contributor to Healthspan, an online retailer of vitamin supplements,Healthspan – About Us and occasionally to other national newspapers and journals. Stuttaford died on 8 June 2018 at the age of 87. ==References== ==Other websites== * The Times column * Peter Allan Sichel Memorial Lecture given by Stuttaford to the Wine and Spirit Education Trust * Critical review of To Your Good Health! on the Institute of Alcohol Studies website * Somewhat disputed article regarding mental and sexual health * The Oldie Magazine Category:1931 births Category:2018 deaths Category:British columnists Category:Conservative Party (UK) MPs Category:English physicians
